message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.CL (Computation and Language) - The paper deals with natural language processing and specifically focuses on learning style-sensitive word vectors, which falls under the scope of this sub-category. 
2. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The proposed method involves extending the CBOW model to learn style-sensitive word vectors, which is a machine learning technique. 
3. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - The paper deals with developing a model that can capture stylistic similarity between words, which is a task that falls under the scope of artificial intelligence. 
4. cs.IR (Information Retrieval) - The proposed task of predicting lexical stylistic similarity can be seen as a sub-task of information retrieval, where the goal is to retrieve documents that are similar in terms of their style. 
5. cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) - The proposed method involves using neural networks to learn style-sensitive word vectors, which falls under the scope of this sub-category.
